reviews.review: This was an awesome film. Yes, there was an SJW message strung throughout the entire film. And, yes, you can see a lot of it coming from a mile away. But it was still an amazing viewing experience. It was probably the funniest movie I have seen in a very long time. Profoundly entertaining!

Great whodunit? Enjoyed a complex plot that doesn't begin to come clear until the last few minuets of the movie.  Daniel Craig plays and excellent investigator without his real British accent. The characters in the film all seem to have a reason to get Christopher Plumber's fortune. No spoilers here. You will have to see it.
It was a good movie. Keep me all the time thinking who was the killer

Loved the Clue vibe but updated. It was interesting to start with the murder already happened and then unravel from there. The acting, writing, and cinematography was superb. My only complaint is that there wasnt much to the kids character at all. I would have liked a thorough dive into each character there and their motives. Make it look like arch one of them were guilty so any one of them could have done it. I secretly hope that they did film it with multiple endings just like Clue. Only time will tell.
Very funny with lots of twists and turns.
Slow to develop but had a good twist to the ending
Very to much hipe for what it was!

My wife and I are in our 60's and we enjoy going out to the movies.  However, most current movies just don't appeal to us for many different reason. We know we are not the demographic the producers are trying to sell to.  However, this movie was fun, entertaining and we enjoyed all the characters.  It is a good old fashioned murder mystery with a great caste and good story line.  It kept our attention the entire film.  Things are not what the initially seem to be.

What a fantastic ride. You've probably seen a "Whodunnit" film in the past, but this one is so fresh and funny that you'll stop wondering about the "Who" and just enjoy the film. You're not sure how it's going to end, but 3/4 of the way through the film you just know Rian Johnson has this in his total control, and the pay off will be sweet. 5/5 you won't regret checking this one out.
